Not a Shutdown: Govt Plans to Curb New Minimarkets in Rural Areas
body: Indonesia may halt new minimarket permits in villages while allowing existing Alfamart and Indomaret outlets to keep operating.

title: Antam Gold Extends Rally as Global Market Sees Profit-Taking
body: Antam gold rose Rp 6,000 to Rp 3.045 million per gram on Friday, extending a two-day rally as global prices faced profit-taking pressure.

title: Prabowo Ends Global Diplomacy Tour with Fresh UAE Investment Pledge
body: However, the Prabowo-MBZ meeting concluded without the signing of concrete deals.

title: JCI Falls 1.35% at Open as S&P Warning and US Solar Tariffs Weigh
body: JCI falls at Friday’s open as S&P warns of fiscal strain and US tariffs on Indonesian solar panels trigger risk-off sentiment.

title: Beyond Tariffs: Indonesia’s Uneven Pact with Washington
body: A study indicates that the risks from the reciprocal trade agreement could outweigh the benefits.

title: Rural Cooperative Drive Sparks Auto Import Dispute and Retail Tensions
body: A minister regards Alfamart and Indomaret as a threat to rural cooperatives and opposes their expansion in villages.

title: Danantara Enters Year Two With $2.7 Trillion Ambition and Rising Scrutiny
body: President Prabowo Subianto has consistently positioned Danantara as a cornerstone of his economic agenda.

title: Indonesia Aims for $17.5 Billion Transactions in Trade Expo
body: Last year, the Trade Expo Indonesia registered $22.8 billion in transactions.

title: Garuda, Citilink, Pelita Air Merger Targeted for Completion This Semester
body: The merger is also expected to address fleet limitations faced by the airlines individually, particularly on overlapping routes.

title: DPR Demands Answers on Agrinas’s $1.5 Billion India Vehicle Deal
body: Parliament summons Agrinas to explain its $1.5 billion plan to import 105,000 fully built vehicles from India.

title: Rupiah Climbs 41 Points as Markets Track US-Iran Talks
body: Rupiah strengthens 41 points to Rp 16,759 as markets monitor US-Iran talks, tariff uncertainty and fading Fed rate cut hopes.

title: JCI Drops 1% as Geopolitics and Kopdes Policy Rattle Investors
body: JCI fell 1.04% to 8,235 as global tensions and plans to curb rural minimarkets overshadowed upbeat Nvidia-driven global cues.

title: Halal Labeling for US Imports Remains Mandatory Under ART Deal
body: Indonesia insists US goods must follow halal rules, with MRA easing process but clear halal and non-halal labels required.

title: Mandiri Sees Indonesia’s Q1 2026 Growth at 5.4% on Spending, Ramadan
body: Indonesia’s economy may grow 5.4% in Q1 2026, driven by Rp 800 trillion in state spending and Ramadan–Eid al Fitr momentum.

title: Antam Gold Jumps to Rp 3.03 Mill as J.P. Morgan Sees Further Rally
body: Antam gold rose Rp 16,000 to Rp 3,039,000, up 22% YTD, as J.P. Morgan forecasts prices could hit $6,300 per ounce.

title: JCI Gains 0.35% at Open, Tracking US Tech-Led Rebound
body: JCI rose 0.35% at the open, tracking Wall Street gains as Nvidia earnings beat expectations and global sentiment improved.

title: China Says Indonesia-US Deal Should Not Harm ‘Any Third Party’
body: Indonesia's largest trading partner China has responded to Jakarta's controversial trade pact with the US.

title: Rupiah Climbs to Rp 16,800 Despite New US Tariff Measures
body: Rupiah rises 29 points to Rp 16,800 per US dollar, brushing off US tariff moves, Fed hold expectations, and Middle East tensions.

title: Govt Says Ride-Hailing Drivers Will Get Eid Bonuses This Year
body: The government also promised to make improvements to the Eid bonus rollout.

title: Is Indonesia’s 19% Tariff Deal Still Valid After the US Supreme Court Ruling?
body: Supreme Court decision shifts legal footing of US tariffs, leaving 19% rate uncertain and 15% as the clearest framework.
